docs.title: prefect-eo
docs.text: Prefect integrations with Earth Observation (EO) data providers.

docs.title: Resources
docs.text: For more tips on how to use tasks and flows in a Collection, check out Using Collections!

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Install prefect-eo with pip:

pip install prefect-eo

Requires an installation of Python 3.8+.

We recommend using a Python virtual environment manager such as pipenv, conda or virtualenv.

These tasks are designed to work with Prefect 2.0. For more information about how to use Prefect, please refer to the Prefect documentation.

docs.title: Feedback
docs.text:
If you encounter any bugs while using prefect-eo, feel free to open an issue in the prefect-eo repository.

If you have any questions or issues while using prefect-eo, you can find help in either the Prefect Discourse forum or the Prefect Slack community.

Feel free to star or watch prefect-eo for updates too!

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
If you'd like to help contribute to fix an issue or add a feature to prefect-eo, please propose changes through a pull request from a fork of the repository.

Here are the steps:

  1. Fork the repository
  2. Clone the forked repository
  3. Install the repository and its dependencies: 
    pip install -e ".[dev]"
  4. Make desired changes
  5. Add tests
  6. Insert an entry to CHANGELOG.md
  7. Install pre-commit to perform quality checks prior to commit: 
    pre-commit install
  8. git commit, git push, and create a pull request

docs.title: Blocks Catalog
docs.text:
Below is a list of Blocks available for registration in prefect-eo.

To register blocks in this module to view and edit them on Prefect Cloud, first install the required packages, then 

prefect block register -m prefect_eo
Note, to use the load method on Blocks, you must already have a block document saved through code or saved through the UI.

docs.title: Earthdata Module
docs.text:
EarthdataCredentials

Block used to manage authentication with NASA Earthdata. NASA Earthdata authentication is handled via the earthaccess module. Refer to the earthaccess docs for more info about the possible credential configurations.

To load the EarthdataCredentials: 

from prefect import flow
from prefect_eo.earthdata import EarthdataCredentials

@flow
def my_flow():
    my_block = EarthdataCredentials.load("MY_BLOCK_NAME")

my_flow()
For additional examples, check out the Earthdata Module under Examples Catalog.

docs.title: EarthdataCredentials
docs.text:
Bases: Block

Block used to manage authentication with NASA Earthdata. NASA Earthdata authentication is handled via the earthaccess module. Refer to the earthaccess docs for more info about the possible credential configurations.

Example

Load stored Earthdata credentials: 

from prefect_eo import EarthdataCredentials

ed_credentials_block = EarthdataCredentials.load("BLOCK_NAME")

Source code in prefect_eo/earthdata.py 
class EarthdataCredentials(Block):
"""
    Block used to manage authentication with NASA Earthdata.
    NASA Earthdata authentication is handled via the `earthaccess` module.
    Refer to the [earthaccess docs](https://nsidc.github.io/earthaccess/)
    for more info about the possible credential configurations.

    Example:
        Load stored Earthdata credentials:
        ```python
        from prefect_eo import EarthdataCredentials

        ed_credentials_block = EarthdataCredentials.load("BLOCK_NAME")
        ```
    """  # noqa E501

    _logo_url = "https://yt3.googleusercontent.com/ytc/AGIKgqPjIUeAw3_hrkHWZgixdwD5jc-hTWweoCA6bJMhUg=s176-c-k-c0x00ffffff-no-rj"  # noqa
    _block_type_name = "NASA Earthdata Credentials"
    _documentation_url = "https://nsidc.github.io/earthaccess/"  # noqa

    earthdata_username: str = Field(
        default=...,
        description="The Earthdata username of a specific account.",
        title="Earthdata username",
    )
    earthdata_password: SecretStr = Field(
        default=...,
        description="The Earthdata password of a specific account.",
        title="Earthdata password",
    )

    def login(self) -> earthaccess.Auth:
"""
        Returns an authenticated session with NASA Earthdata

        Example:
            ```python
            earthdata_credentials_block = EarthdataCredentials(
                earthdata_username = "username",
                earthdata_password = "password"
            )
            earthdata_auth = earthdata_credentials_block.login()
            ```
        """

""""""

        os.environ["EARTHDATA_USERNAME"] = self.earthdata_username
        os.environ["EARTHDATA_PASSWORD"] = self.earthdata_password.get_secret_value()
        return earthaccess.login(strategy="environment")

docs.title: login
docs.text:
Returns an authenticated session with NASA Earthdata

Example 
earthdata_credentials_block = EarthdataCredentials(
    earthdata_username = "username",
    earthdata_password = "password"
)
earthdata_auth = earthdata_credentials_block.login()
Source code in prefect_eo/earthdata.py 
def login(self) -> earthaccess.Auth:
"""
    Returns an authenticated session with NASA Earthdata

    Example:
        ```python
        earthdata_credentials_block = EarthdataCredentials(
            earthdata_username = "username",
            earthdata_password = "password"
        )
        earthdata_auth = earthdata_credentials_block.login()
        ```
    """

""""""

    os.environ["EARTHDATA_USERNAME"] = self.earthdata_username
    os.environ["EARTHDATA_PASSWORD"] = self.earthdata_password.get_secret_value()
    return earthaccess.login(strategy="environment")
